name: Toronto Beatlemania
description:
Calling Toronto Beatles fans!
 
Join us for our return for the third year in a row! 

Travel through time - From early Ed Sullivan to Let it Be, you'll get all the hits. Experience this live Beatles performance through all eras of their career, performed on stage by The Liverpool 4 with the same high energy, impeccable musicianship, showmanship, fun and humour.

The show performance is two acts with a 20-minute intermission. It must be experienced to be believed. Come together and sing and dance along, clap your hands, stomp your feet, or just rattle your jewelry!

name: Tom Allen and Friends "J.S. Bach's Long Walk in the Snow"

location.name: Jane Mallett Theatre, St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts

description:
We often picture Bach as a wise master, but in his late teens, he was as fiery as he was gifted. Determined to hear the great organist Dietrich Buxtehude, he set off on foot from Arnstadt to Lübeck, a staggering 400 km journey!

Hosted by CBC's Tom Allen, the evening features harpist Lori Gemmel, pianist Jamie Parker, accordionist Michael Bridge, violinist Annalee Patipatanakoon, and the genre-expanding soprano Patricia O'Callaghan in a thrilling, wide-ranging performance.

One of three presentations in our new MUSE series (Music Unveiled, Stories, Explorations), Allens' captivating production blends music and storytelling to bring this chapter of young Bach's story to vivid life.

Enjoy a program of music by Johann Sebastian Bach, Dietrich Buxtehude, Sofia Gubaidulina, Sergei Rachmaninoff, Charles Gounod, and Tom Waits.

name: Intrigue at the Museum: A Mystery Scavenger Hunt at ROM
description:
(Formerly called Murder at the ROM)

Back by popular demand, our classic ROM mystery scavenger hunt returns!

There has been a mysterious murder, and the museum's collections hold the key.  As you gather clues, you'll begin to piece together a tale of greed, lust, pride, and revenge. Working in teams, sleuths travel through the museum's galleries solving whodunnit, where, and with what. Will your team solve the mystery before the clock runs out?

Note:  At least one player per team must bring a phone with our scavenger hunt app downloaded for submitting answers and creative team photos and videos during the adventure, but the more the merrier! Click on our link to book your tickets, and see more details about your upcoming hunt.

This hunt is a product of Urban Capers Scavenger Hunts, and any questions relating to the product, tickets, location, etc. should be directed to Urban Capers at info@urbancapers.com. We're happy to help.

name: Riverside Holiday Market
description:
We're bringing the holiday cheer! 

Enjoy activities including meet and greets with Santa, live Music and hot chocolate, kids crafts and treats, and holiday shopping with goods from over 20 local vendors.

name: Don't Give Up: The Music of Kate Bush and Peter Gabriel
description:
Featuring performances by art-pop icon and theatrical powerhouse Sarah Slean, soulful master cellist and vocalist Kevin Fox, lyrical song stylist with jazz, folk and chamber pop roots Lori Cullen and gospel-tinged pianist and singer Michelle Willis.

Tune into how these performers bring to life, the music of Kate Bush and Peter Gabriel.

name: Toronto Sunday Market
description:
A curated shopping experience featuring Toronto's best local makers, vintage vendors, and food artisans inside the historic Parkdale Hall. 

Each weekend offers new vendors, a relaxed atmosphere, and the perfect chance to find unique items while supporting small businesses.

name: Three AM Page
description: Two resident doctors making indie rock music from their bedrooms stacking pizza boxes as mic stands - fragile, a little unhinged and very sleep deprived.

name: Youth Arts Mentorship at Fort York: Your Creative Why
description:
Beginning November 23 at Fort York, discover the vibrant voices of 12 young Toronto artists under the mentorship of Alex Malamas and Grizzly Visualz. Their photographs are the result of connecting intention, alignment and expression, leaning into their intuition and curiosity to create and express their stories through a visual medium with clarity and confidence.

Celebrate the creativity, passion and stories of youth in a series of eight inspiring installations across the city at Toronto History Museum sites. These installations are produced under the Youth Arts Mentorship program, which empowers emerging talent to experience self-discovery and artistic expression through visual arts.

name: Sunday Variety Market

location.name: St. Lawrence Market - UNDER THE BIG WHITE TENT

description:
We are about to create the coziest and coolest place to shop small this holiday season, under the big white tent! We host hundreds of small business vendors and for the first time ever we will be open Saturday & Sunday for 5 weeks leading up to Christmas!

Fun will be had, finds will be found & bells will be ringing!

name: Tony Siqi Yun on Piano

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Mr. Yun has been hailed by Pianist Magazine as a "poet of the keyboard" and The Philadelphia Inquirer noted his thrilling performance and "interpretive flashes that point to an emergent big personality: moments of grandness or deep expressivity". 

He made his Carnegie Hall debut in 2023-24 under the baton of Yannick Nézet-Séguin with Orchestre Métropolitain, following his 2022-23 debut with the Philadelphia Orchestra. Mr. Yun has appeared recently with the Toronto Symphony Orchestra, Baltimore Symphony, Calgary Philharmonic, Buffalo Philharmonic, Hamilton Philharmonic, and Rhode Island Philharmonic; outside North America, he has recently appeared with Orchestre de Chambre de Paris and Shanghai Symphony Orchestra.

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.

name: Northern Lights: Inspired by Canada
description:
Discover the beauty and diversity of Canada!

This remarkable performance celebrates our rich cultural tapestry and natural wonders, featuring compositions by Canadian composers that reflect the spirit, landscapes, and stories of our great nation. From stirring classical melodies to innovative new works, we're bringin music to life. Don't miss this unforgettable evening of artistry, emotion, and national pride that showcases the true essence of our musical heritage. Featuring guest artist Mireille Asselin.

name: Hiran
description:
Toronto closes this powerful mini-tour with Hiran's dynamic show in honour of Brazilian Black Awareness Month. 

Blending Afro-Brazilian roots, rap, and pop, Hiran creates a space for celebration, pride, and connection, uniting the community through rhythm, art, and love.
